qas.question: What films did Spielberg turn down in the 70s?
How many Oscars did Close Encounters win?
How many Oscars did Close Encounters get nominated for, besides Best Director?
In what year did Vilmos Zsigmond become a cinematographer?
In what year did Frank E. Warner become a sound effects editor?
How much did Close Encounters earn overseas?
How much did 1941 earn in the US?

context: Rejecting offers to direct <a0_0>Jaws 2, King Kong and Superman<a0_0/>, Spielberg and actor <b8_0>Richard Dreyfuss<b8_0/> re-convened to work on a film about UFOs, which became Close Encounters of the Third Kind (1977). One of the rare films both written and directed by Spielberg, Close Encounters was a critical and box office hit, giving Spielberg his first Best Director nomination from the Academy as well as earning <a2_0>six<a2_0/> other Academy Awards nominations. It won Oscars in <a1_0>two<a1_0/> categories (Cinematography, Vilmos Zsigmond, and a Special Achievement Award for Sound Effects Editing, Frank E. Warner). This second blockbuster helped to secure Spielberg's rise. His next film, <b5_0><b6_0>1941<b6_0/><b5_0/>, a big-budgeted <a3_0>World War II farce<a3_0/>, was not nearly as successful and though it grossed <a4_0>over <b7_0><b9_0>$92.4<b7_0/> million<b9_0/> worldwide<a4_0/> (and did make a small profit for co-producing studios Columbia and Universal) it was seen as a disappointment, mainly with the critics.
